block.p: Theater

''ELLIE AND THE PRINCE,'' a modern version of the Cinderella tale, using Beatles music, presented by Downtown Art, 64 East Fourth Street, East Village. Fridays and Saturdays at 7:30 p.m. and Sundays at 2 p.m. through Jan. 11 (except Dec. 26 to 28). Tickets, $5; 18 and under, $4. Reservations: (212) 505-0835.

JIM WEST IN ''MORE AESOP'S FABLES,'' a puppet production by Theaterworks/USA, tomorrow at 2 p.m. at Kingsborough Community College, 2001 Oriental Boulevard, Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn, (718) 368-5596. Tickets, $8.
A selective listing of childrens events in the New York region this weekend.
Theater

''ELLIE AND THE PRINCE,'' a modern version of the Cinderella tale, using Beatles music, presented by Downtown Art, 64 East Fourth Street, East Village. Fridays and Saturdays at 7:30 p.m. and Sundays at 2 p.m. through Jan. 11 (except Dec. 26 to 28). Tickets, $5; 18 and under, $4. Reservations: (212) 505-0835.

JIM WEST IN ''MORE AESOP'S FABLES,'' a puppet production by Theaterworks/USA, tomorrow at 2 p.m. at Kingsborough Community College, 2001 Oriental Boulevard, Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn, (718) 368-5596. Tickets, $8.

''ROMEO AND JULIET,'' Shakespeare's tragedy by the Pied Piper Children's Theater of New York at the Holy Trinity Church-Inwood, 20 Cumming Street. Tomorrow at 3 and 7 p.m. and Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $7; under 18, $4. Information: (212) 544-2976.

''THE PEOPLE GARDEN,'' a musical for ages 3 to 12 about a kindergarten class and its substitute teacher, Saturdays at 11 a.m. through Jan. 31 at the York Theater, St. Peter's Lutheran Church, Lexington Avenue, at 54th Street. Tickets: $20. Smarttix: (212) 868-4444.

''THE VICTORY OVER EVERYTHING CIRCUS,'' a blend of slapstick, dance and music by the Bread and Puppet Theater at the Theater for a New City, 155 First Avenue, at 10th Street, East Village. Saturdays and Sundays at 3 p.m. through Dec. 21. Tickets: $10; under 12, $5. Reservations: (212) 254-1109.

''A PRINCESS, AN EMPEROR AND A DUCK,'' a new puppet production based on stories by Hans Christian Andersen, at the Swedish Cottage Marionette Theater in Central Park, reachable from Central Park West and 81st Street, or Fifth Avenue and 79th Street. Current schedule: Tuesdays through Fridays at 10:30 a.m. and noon and Saturdays at 1 p.m. Suggested donation: $6; children, $5. Through April 3. Reservations: (212) 988-9093.

''LITTLE RED RIDING HOOD/LA CAPERUCITA ROJA,'' a bilingual (Spanish and English) version of the tale, by Teatro SEA at Los Kabayitos Puppet and Children's Theater, 107 Suffolk Street (between Rivington and Delancey), second floor, Lower East Side. Tomorrow and Dec. 20 at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12; children, $10. Reservations: (212) 260-4080, Ext. 14.
Events

''JAZZ FOR YOUNG PEOPLE: WHO IS MILES DAVIS?,'' a concert and discussion about Davis and his trumpet with Wynton Marsalis and others, tomorrow at 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. at Alice Tully Hall, Lincoln Center. Budding jazz musicians can take their instruments for an after-concert jam session. Tickets: $20; students, $15. Information: (212) 721-6500.

ASTOUNDING SCIENCE FOR FAMILIES, where fire extinguishers are turned into mini-rockets and flowers become as fragile as china, on Sunday at 1 and 3 p.m. in the Kaufmann Theater at the American Museum of Natural History, Central Park West and 79th Street, (212) 769-5200. Presented by the department of physics and astronomy at Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey. Free with museum admission: $12; students, $9; 12 and under, $7; under 2, free.

''HOLIDAY ON THE HUDSON,'' a free ice skating demonstration by staff members of the Sky Rink and youngsters from the rink's skating school, tonight at 7 at Sky Rink, Chelsea Piers, Pier 61, 23rd Street and the West Side Highway. Tickets are available at Sky Rink. Free. Free skating, skate rental included, follows the show. Information: (212) 336-6100.

HANUKKAH CRAFTS, based on ''From Tent to Temple,'' an interactive exhibition about life in ancient times, Sunday from 2 to 5 p.m. at the Children's Galleries for Jewish Culture, 515 West 20th Street, Chelsea, (212) 924-4500. Youngsters will make lamps, dreidels and models. Fee: $5 (includes admission).

''THE STORY OF THE ALAMO -- FACT, FICTION AND FUN WEEKEND,'' with square dancing, songs and stories, tomorrow and Sunday, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m., at the Children's Museum of Manhattan, the Tisch Building, 212 West 83rd Street, (212) 721-1223. Admission, $7.

''KIDS 'N' COMEDY,'' a stand-up showcase for comedians aged 8 to 15, Sunday at 3 p.m. at the Gotham Comedy Club, 34 West 22nd Street, Flatiron district. Tickets: $15, plus a one-soft-drink minimum. Information: (212) 877-6115.
SPARE TIMES
